Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a deep carinated body with a double chamber. The end of the long nozzle is missing; on the nozzle-top is an oval raised area and two surviving raised transverse segments. There is a raised rim around the plain filling-hole area. On the left side is a pierced lug. At the rear is a palmette handle. The raised base is almost circular, and flat below. Covered with red slip, mainly on the upper side.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q554.bis)
